events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and a roadside barrier causing substantial damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial incident description and keywords.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation and communication with the customer.
The customer was sent an acknowledgement confirming receipt of the claim and providing next steps.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for verification.
The customer uploaded all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the collision damage.
The insurer began the investigation by evaluating submitted evidence and scheduling a vehicle inspection.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the collision damage matched the reported incident.
The proposed settlement offer was communicated to the customer outlining the repair costs coverage and deductibles.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and thanked the agent for clear communication.
Management approved the claim in full based on investigation findings and customer acceptance of the settlement.
The payment covering repair costs minus deductible was processed and issued to the customer’s bank account.
The claim file was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmed repairs by the auto shop.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived in the company system for future reference and audit.
